en: You don’t know what’s going on, but Sandra is dead and Sandra is dead and Sandra. Is. Dead.
zh: 你不知道發生了什麼，但桑德拉死了，桑德拉死了。

en: You must have fallen asleep and when you woke there was a gun in your hand and why is Sandra dead? What happened?
zh: 你一定是睡著了，當你醒來時，你的手裡握著一把槍，桑德拉為什麼死了？

en: You must have shot her because there’s a hole in her chest and her body is cool and it must have been a while ago and— You don’t know.
zh: 發生了什麼？一定是你開槍打死了她，因為她的胸部有一個彈孔，她的屍體冰涼，一定有一段時間了，而且——你不知道。

en: You don’t know.
zh: 你不知道。

en: The Madness Journal, now more important than ever to get your thoughts down. Important to write and remember.
zh: 「狂人日記」，現在更重要的是把你的想法記下來，更重要的是把它們寫下來，記住啊。

en: But write what?
zh: 但是，寫什麼呢？

en: You don’t. Know.
zh: 你不知道。

en: What happened.
zh: 不知道啊。發生了什麼。

en: Jerry doesn’t know.
zh: 傑瑞不知道。

en: Henry doesn’t know.
zh: 亨利不知道。

en: Jerry and Henry are similar sounding names and you don’t know if you’ve ever noticed that before
zh: 傑瑞和亨利這兩個名字的讀音相似，不知道你之前是否注意到了。

en: You must have, really, and Sandra is dead in your office and.
zh: 真的，桑德拉死在你的寫作房裡。

en: She’s lying on the floor and. There’s blood all around her, it’s leaked.
zh: 她躺在地板上，周圍全是血。

en: Don’t know what to do.
zh: 你不知道該怎麼辦。

en: Since the police aren’t here it means she was shot in your office and nobody heard anything, which makes sense because that’s where she is, that’s where the blood is, and.
zh: 警察不在這裏，這意味著她在你的寫作房裡遭到槍殺，沒有人聽到任何聲音，這符合常理，因為她死在你的寫作房裡，周邊全是血。

en: Think.
zh: 好好想想。

en: Think, Jerry.
zh: 好好想想，傑瑞。

en: Think and remember.
zh: 好好想想，記住啊。

en: What do you remember?
zh: 你記得什麼呢？

en: Nothing, but a quick look back into the Madness Journal tells a sorry story of a man taping trash bags to the walls and sitting in the chair and the safety stopping the gun from going off and then Sandra arriving, but you me us we don’t remember what you spoke about but it’s there in the journal and you’ve read it and you called Hans, you called him six hours ago, and the cat died years ago, but you still tried to buy cat food for it, which was way before the baker fucked Sandra and you fucked the wedding and you need to call Hans again to see if he did come around and if he did you need to ask what you spoke about and you need to know what made you angry enough to.
zh: 什麼也不記得，但是，快速掃一眼「狂人日記」，日記在講述一個悲慘的故事，那人在牆上粘好垃圾袋，坐在椅子上；槍的保險栓關著，所以無法射擊，然後桑德拉過來了。我們都不記得和桑德拉說過什麼，但一切都寫在日記里，你已經讀過了。你打電話給漢斯，六個小時前你就打電話給他了；貓在幾年前就死了，但你仍然在給它買貓食；再之前，麵包師和桑德拉苟且偷|歡，你搞砸了婚禮。

en: You don’t know.
zh: 你不知道該怎麼做。你不知道。

en: “And he answered?”
zh: 「他結婚了？」

en: “Wait here,” Hans says, and he turns off the headlights before getting out of the car.
zh: 「在這兒等一下。」漢斯說。他關掉前燈，下了車。

en: Then he leans back in. “I mean it, Jerry. I’m only going to be gone a minute, but don’t wander off, okay?”
zh: 過後他又回來：「我是認真的，傑瑞，我只離開一分鐘，不要出去遊盪了，好嗎？」

en: “Is that meant to be a joke?”
zh: 「這是在開玩笑吧？」

en: “It was meant to be, but halfway through it stopped being funny.”
zh: 「是打算開玩笑的，但過一會兒就沒那麼有趣了。」

en: Hans walks up to the front door reaching into his pocket along the way, then he’s in the dark and Jerry can’t see what he’s doing, but he knows his friend is most likely picking the lock, something he’s always thought is a cool trick for his characters, but something he’d never be able to do in real life.
zh: 漢斯走向前門走去，一路上將手插|進口袋裡。他消失在夜幕當中，傑瑞看不見他在做什麼，但他知道他的朋友很有可能在撬鎖，他一直認為這是他書中人物酷炫的技巧，但在現實生活中他永遠做不到。

en: You can do it, Henry says, and Jerry decides it’s neither here nor there.
zh: 「你可以做到。」亨利說，但傑瑞認為這無關緊要了。

en: A minute later Hans is heading back. He’s wearing a pair of thin leather gloves.
zh: 一分鐘后，漢斯回來了，戴著一雙薄皮手套。

en: He glances at the doll on the fence, and Jerry wonders if he’s conjuring up the same kind of images that Horror Book Henry would have thought back in the days when fiction and nonfiction were two completely different things.
zh: 他看了一眼柵欄上的娃娃，傑瑞心裏納悶，當文學與紀實還是兩個完全不同的概念時，他就能召喚出當年寫恐怖小說的亨利在腦海中浮現的世界？

en: In another universe, that doll could pull the nail out of its own face and carry on doing what it was doing before somebody assaulted it.
zh: 在那個世界中，娃娃可以把釘子從自己的臉上拔|出|來，繼續做著它被釘在柵欄前的事。

en: It’s awkward getting Eric out of the back of the car. He’s heavier than Mrs. Smith, and Jerry is sure he’ll have a sore back tomorrow from all this lifting.
zh: 把艾瑞克從車後座弄出來挺棘手的，他比史密斯太太重太多了。

en: But they get Eric upright, and then they get him up the driveway and past the wide open door and into a hallway.
zh: 他們扶著艾瑞克站起來，攙著他走過車道，穿過寬敞的門進入走廊。

en: Before lifting him, Jerry took Eric’s glasses off and put them into his pocket for safekeeping.
zh: 在把他抬起來之前，傑瑞把艾瑞克的眼鏡摘了下來，放進口袋裡保管。

en: It’s dark inside and Hans manages to point his cell phone light ahead as they walk, giving Jerry a brief rundown along the way.
zh: 裏面漆黑一片，漢斯打開手機，藉助著屏幕發出的微光繼續向前走著，傑瑞一路上磕磕絆絆，累得夠嗆。

en: “Used to be a drug house,” he says. “It was just small-time stuff, mostly just a couple of guys selling weed to partying teenagers, but the guys were informants for the police, so the police let them do their thing as long as their thing didn’t go beyond that, but of course it went beyond that because they got into some beef with another couple of guys a few blocks away, and next thing you know the average life expectancy in the neighborhood drops substantially.
zh: 漢斯說：「原先這裡是個製藥廠，生產的都是些劣貨，向幾個愛尋歡作樂的青少年賣煙草和大麻，但因為這些傢伙是警察的線人，所以警察聽任他們放縱自己，只要他們做的事情不出格。

en: Jerry looks concerned, and Hans laughs. “Don’t worry, I’m kidding.
zh: 傑瑞憂心忡忡的，漢斯接著笑道：「別擔心，我在開玩笑。

en: They did find them.
zh: 他們找到了。

en: Anyway, that shit was months ago, and nobody ever comes by here, and the police have no reason to.
zh: 不管怎樣，那都是幾個月前的破事了，沒有人來過這裏，警察更沒有理由來。

en: Come on, let’s get this guy upstairs.”
zh: 來，讓我們把這個傢伙抬到樓上。」

en: There is no furniture in the house, nothing to try and avoid, no rug to trip on.
zh: 房子里沒有傢具，所以沒有什麼好避讓的，不用擔心會有地毯把人絆倒。

en: They get to the stairs and it’s a tight squeeze and Jerry’s not sure what the difference is going to be upstairs compared to downstairs when it comes to questioning somebody, but there must be something significant to be going through all of this.
zh: 他們爬上樓梯，但樓梯太狹窄了。傑瑞不知道既然是要審問，那麼樓上和樓下能有什麼差別？

en: He thought by now they’d have Eric strapped into a chair with a knife to his throat, but there are no chairs and no knives.
zh: 漢斯這樣折騰一定有他的主意。他心裏想著他們會把艾瑞克綁在椅子上，用刀指著他的喉嚨，但這裏既沒有椅子，也沒有刀。

en: Upstairs smells like cat piss and the air is stale.
zh: 樓上散發著刺鼻的貓尿味，四處瀰漫著陳腐的氣息。

en: Every wall he looks at he can imagine two men nailed to it.
zh: 看到一面牆他就忍不住想會不會有兩個人釘在上面。

en: They dump Eric on the landing because they’re both too exhausted to drag him further.
zh: 他們把艾瑞克放在樓梯口，他們倆都太累了，再也拖不動他。

en: “You okay, buddy?”
zh: 「你還好吧，老兄？」

en: Hans asks, puffing a little.
zh: 漢斯氣喘吁吁地問道。

en: “No,” Jerry says.
zh: 「不好。」傑瑞說，「一點兒也不好。

en: Now what?”
zh: 現在該怎麼辦？」

en: “Now we get him to talk.”
zh: 「讓他說話。」

en: “We hang him out the window.”
zh: 「把他掛在窗外。」

en: “You’re kidding, right?”
zh: 「你在開玩笑吧？」

en: “It’s the easiest way.”
zh: 「這是最簡單的方法。」

en: “You’ve done it before?”
zh: 「你以前試過嗎？」

en: “I’ve seen it done,” Hans says.
zh: 「我見過。」漢斯說。

en: “In real life?”
zh: 「在真實生活中嗎？」

en: “In movies,” Hans says. “It always works.”
zh: 「在電影里，」漢斯說，「非常有效。」

en: “But won’t he just tell us what we want to hear if we do that?
zh: 「要是我們這樣做了，他就告訴我們想聽的一切，那該怎麼辦？

en: It won’t count, right?
zh: 這沒有意義，對吧？

en: I’d confess to anything if it’d stop me from getting dropped on my head.”
zh: 只要能救我的命，只要不把我頭朝下扔出去，我什麼都會承認。」

en: “Then we make him tell us something only the killer would know.”
zh: 「那麼，我們讓他告訴我們只有兇手才會知道的東西。」

en: “And what if he isn’t the killer?
zh: 「如果他不是兇手該怎麼辦？

en: What if I really am?”
zh: 如果真的是我該怎麼辦？」

en: “Then if you’re a killer, you shouldn’t be feeling too bad about this, right?”
zh: 「如果你是兇手，你不應該會如此反對，對吧？」

en: “Look at where we are, Jerry. Look at the situation we’re in. You’re lucky the taxi driver earlier didn’t figure out who you were. You’re a wanted man who is running out of time, and if you’re to be believed, an innocent man.
zh: 「看看我們現在落到什麼境地了，傑瑞，你很幸運早些時候計程車司機沒有認出你是誰，你可是一個被警方通緝的人。

en: If you don’t want to do this, then fine, we take Eric back home and drop you off with the police and you won’t get to look for your journal and you’ll plead guilty and Eva will continue to never want to speak to you, and the police will blame you for every unsolved crime over the last thirty years.
zh: 你時日不多了，如果人們相信你，你就是一個無辜的人。如果你不想這樣做，那麼行，我們把艾瑞克帶回家，再把你帶到警局，你就不能去找日記，只能伏法認罪，伊娃仍然不想和你說話，警察會把過去三十年沒有偵破的案件都算到你頭上。

en: Or we trust your gut, and we question him.”
zh: 或者，我們相信你的本能直覺，我們審審他。」

en: Jerry nods. The decision made.
zh: 傑瑞點點頭，他做出決定了。

en: They drag Eric into the nearest bedroom.
zh: 他們把艾瑞克拖進最近的卧室。

en: Houses always look sad when they’re empty, Jerry thinks, and this house looks so sad he feels like they ought to put it out of its misery by torching it when they leave.
zh: 傑瑞心想，一旦人去樓空，房子就會看上去荒蕪不堪。他覺得為了把房子從痛苦的境地解脫出來，他們離開時應該放一把火把它燒掉。

en: There is wallpaper hanging from the walls and large stains in the carpets and funnyshaped circles of mold on the ceiling.
zh: 牆上垂下壁紙，地毯上有大片大片的污跡，天花板上有因發霉形成的形狀怪誕的圖案。

en: He can’t imagine what a real estate agent would say as a selling point—unless they listed it as an ideal home for the budding pyromaniac.
zh: 他想象不出房地產經紀人會拿什麼作為賣點進行宣傳，除非他們把它冠以「初出茅廬的縱火狂的理想家居型」這種概念。

en: The bedroom is facing south, over the backyard, where there is very little in the way of light, but just enough to see the backyard has been paved in concrete too. Jerry guesses the previous owner hated gardening.
zh: 卧室朝南，面向後院，光線昏暗，但是足以看到後院也鋪設著混凝土，傑瑞猜測先前的主人一定不喜歡園藝。

en: Hans unlocks the window, then has to shoulder it upwards because it’s swollen in the damp air.
zh: 漢斯打開窗戶，但是他必須用力向上托，因為空氣潮濕致使窗戶都走樣變形了。

en: Eric is still unconscious, and he’s still wearing his orderly clothes from the home. Seeing him here is so out of context but not enough to jar Jerry back into the world of rational thought, because surely he can’t be there now.
zh: 艾瑞克仍舊昏迷著，他還穿著療養院的白大褂，在這裏看到他有些不倫不類，不足以讓傑瑞回到理性思維的世界中，因為他並沒有置身在理性世界的感覺。

en: “We wake him up, and then we hang him outside,” Hans says, and he takes the tape off Eric’s eyes, but leaves the one over his mouth.
zh: 「我們把他弄醒，然後把他掛在外面。」漢斯說著撕下艾瑞克眼睛上的膠帶，但沒動他嘴上的膠帶。

en: “We let him get a good look around, and then we drag him back in. I’ll slap him around a little, and we don’t ask questions, what we do is we give him statements.
zh: 「我們讓他好好看看周圍的環境，再把他拖回來，我會給他幾巴掌，我們不問他問題，只是給他暗示。

en: We don’t say Did you kill those girls?
zh: 我們不說：『是你殺了那些女孩嗎？』

en: What we say is We know you killed those girls. Got it?”
zh: 我們應該說：『我們知道你殺了那些女孩。』

en: “I got it,” Jerry says, his stomach turning at the thought, but not turning as much as Eric’s will be.
zh: 「明白了。」傑瑞說。一想到漢斯的主意，他的胃就開始翻騰，但艾瑞克的胃可能比他翻騰得還要厲害。

en: “I won’t.”
zh: 「不要放手。」

en: “And I want you to keep thinking about where you hid your journal, okay?”
zh: 「我希望你繼續回想把日記藏在哪裡了，好嗎？」

en: “I’m trying.”
zh: 「我儘力。」

en: “Then try harder.”
zh: 「再加把勁。」

en: “It doesn’t work like that,” Jerry says.
zh: 「這樣沒用的。」傑瑞說。

en: “You ready?”
zh: 「你準備好了嗎？」

en: “As ready as I’ll ever be.”
zh: 「準備好了。」

en: Hans wraps duct tape around Eric’s ankles, pinning his feet together. Then from his pocket he pulls out a small vial.
zh: 漢斯把膠帶纏在艾瑞克的腳踝上，把兩隻腳拴在一起，然後從口袋裡取出一個小瓶。

en: “Smelling salts,” he says.
zh: 「嗅鹽。」

en: “Trust me, Jerry, everything is going to be okay,” he says, and he opens the top and waves the vial under Eric’s nose.
zh: 他說，「相信我，傑瑞，一切都會好起來的。」說著，他打開瓶蓋，在艾瑞克的鼻子下揮了揮。
